oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Summer F. Slaton to his father Thomas M. Slaton
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. Summer F. Slaton, Co. K, 21st Ky. Inf. Regt., USA to his father Thomas M. Slaton in Hopkinsville, Ky. Pvt. Slaton went into the army as a substitute for a drafted soldier. In this letter Slaton discusses the Battle of Nashville, Tenn. He also mentions General William T. Sherman's advance on Charleston, SC and tells his father that he regrets having joined the army and wishes he was at home tending hogs. Slaton died of chronic diarrhea in a field hospital near Nashville on May 24, 1865.
